title: NACC Uniform Data Set (UDS) - INITIAL VISIT PACKET - FORM A3: SUBJECT FAMILY HISTORY
description: INSTRUCTIONS: This form is to be completed by a clinician with experience in evaluating patients with neurological problems and psychiatric conditions. For additional clarification and examples, see UDS Coding Guidebook for Initial Visit Packet, Form A3. Link to NACC Coding Guidebook

afffamm.title: 1. Are there affected first-degree relatives (biological parents, full siblings, or biological children)?
afffamm.description: "Affected" = having dementia or one of the non-normal diagnoses listed in Appendix 1 on page 5

fadmut.title: 2a. In this family, is there evidence for an AD mutation? If Yes, select predominant mutation.
fadmut.description: NOTE: APOE Should not be reported here.
enum: 9 Unknown whether mutation exists (SKIP TO QUESTION 3a)

fadmutx.title: 2a1. Other (specify predominant AD mutation in this family):
fadmutx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes('), double quotes ("), ampersnads (&), and percentage signs(%).)

fadmuso.title: 2b. Source of evidence for AD mutation (check one):

fadmusox.title: 2b1. Other (specify the other source of evidence -AD mutation in this family)
fadmusox.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes('), double quotes ("), ampersnads (&), and percentage signs (%).)

fftdmut.title: 3a. In this family, is there evidence for an FTLD mutation? If Yes, select predominant mutation.
enum: 9 Unknown whether mutation exists (SKIP TO QUESTION 4a)

fftdmutx.title: 3a1. Other (specify the predominant FTLD mutation in this family)
fftdmutx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes('), double quotes ("), ampersnads (&), and percentage signs (%).)

fftdmuso.title: 3b. Source of evidence for FTLD mutation (check one):

fftdmusx.title: 3b1.  Other (Specify the other source of evidence -FTLD mutation in this family)
fftdmusx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes('), double quotes ("), ampersnads (&), and percentage signs (%).)

fothmut.title: 4a. In this family, is there evidence for a mutation other than an AD or FTLD mutation?  (If No or Unknown, SKIP TO QUESTION 5a)

fothmutx.title: 4a1. Other (specify the other mutation in this family)
fothmutx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes('), double quotes ("), ampersnads (&), and percentage signs (%).)

fothmuso.title: 4b. Source of evidence for other mutation (check one):

fothmusx.title: 4b1.  Other (Specify the other source of evidence -  other mutation in this family)
fothmusx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes('), double quotes ("), ampersnads (&), and percentage signs (%).)

note_a3_1.title: BIOLOGICAL PARENTS:
note_a3_1.description: Provide information on biological parents below. If birth year is unknown, please provide an approximate year on the Initial Visit Form A3 and ensure that it is consistently reported on any Follow-up Visit Form A   as applicable. If it is impossible for the subject and co-participant to estimate the birth year, enter 9999=Unknown.   For any biological parent with a neurological or psychiatric condition, the entire row must be filled out. If the clinician cannot determine the primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition after reviewing all available evidence, enter 9=Unknown in the Primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition column, and then skip the subsequent questions in the row. For a biological parent with no neurological or psychiatric problem, enter 8=N/A - no neurological problem or psychiatric condition in the Primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition column, and then skip the subsequent questions in the row.   pdf below contains codes for Method of Evaluation

momyob.title: 5a2. Mother - Birth Year
momyob.description: (Date can be submitted as YYYY.((YYYY) 1875 to 2099, 9999 = Unknown)

momneur.title: 5a4. Mother - Primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition*
momneur.description: (*CODES for neurological problems and psychiatric conditions)
enum: 4 Other neurologic condition such as multiple sclerosis or stroke
5 Psychiatric condition such as schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, alcoholism, or depression
8 N/A, no neurological problem or psychiatric condition

momprdx.title: 5a5. Mother - Primary Dx**
enum: 040 Mild cognitive impairment (MCI), not otherwise specified
133 Primary progressive aphasia, not otherwise specified
999 Specific diagnosis unknown (acceptable if method of evaluation is not by autopsy, examination, or dementia evaluation)
431 FTLD with Tau pathology - Pick's disease
434 FTLD with Tau pathology - argyrophyllic grains
490 Other neuropathologic diagnosis not listed above

mommoe.title: 5a6. Mother - Method of evaluation***
mommoe.description: (***CODES for method of evaluation - See File Repository for APPENDIX 2: METHOD OF EVALUATION)
enum: 3 Medical record review from formal dementia evaluation
4 Review of general medical records AND co-participant and/or subject telephone interview
5 Review of general medical records only

dadyob.title: 5b2. Father - Birth year
dadyob.description: (Date can be submitted as YYYY.((YYYY) 1875 to 2099, 9999 = Unknown)

dadneur.title: 5b4. Father - Primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition*
dadneur.description: (*CODES for neurological problems and psychiatric conditions)
enum: 4 Other neurologic condition such as multiple sclerosis or stroke
5 Psychiatric condition such as schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, alcoholism, or depression
8 N/A, no neurological problem or psychiatric condition

dadprdx.title: 5b5. Father - Primary Dx**
enum: 040 Mild cognitive impairment (MCI), not otherwise specified
133 Primary progressive aphasia, not otherwise specified
999 Specific diagnosis unknown (acceptable if method of evaluation is not by autopsy, examination, or dementia evaluation)
431 FTLD with Tau pathology - Pick's disease
434 FTLD with Tau pathology - argyrophyllic grains
490 Other neuropathologic diagnosis not listed above

dadmoe.title: 5b6. Father - Method of evaluation***
dadmoe.description: (***CODES for method of evaluation - See File Repository for APPENDIX 2: METHOD OF EVALUATION)
enum: 3 Medical record review from formal dementia evaluation
4 Review of general medical records AND co-participant and/or subject telephone interview
5 Review of general medical records only

note_a3_2.title: Year of birth for full siblings and biological children:
note_a3_2.description: If birth year is unknown, please provide an approximate year on UDS Initial Visit Form A3 and UDS Follow-up Visit Form A3 so that the sibling/child with unknown birth year ends up in correct birth order relative to the other siblings/children.Example: A subject is the oldest of three children. The subject was born in 1940 and the middle sibling in 1943; the youngest sibling's birth year is unknown. An approximate birth year of 1944 or later should be assigned to the youngest sibling.Use that same birth year on FTLD Module Form A3a, if applicable, and across all UDS visits so that any new information on a particular sibling or child can be linked to previously submitted information. If it is impossible for the subject and co-participant to estimate year of birth, enter 9999=Unknown.

sibs.title: 6. How many full siblings does the subject have?
sibs.description: If subject has no full siblings,  SKIP TO QUESTION 7; otherwise provide information on all full siblings below.For any full sibling with a neurological or psychiatric condition, the entire row must be filled out. If the clinician cannot determine the primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition after reviewing all avilable evidence, enter 9=Unknown in the Primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition column, and then skip the subsequent questions in the row. For a siblng with no neurological or psychiatric problem, enter 8=N/A - no neurological problem or psychiatric condition in the Primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition column, and then skip the subsequent questions in the row.( 77 = Adopted, unknown)

sib1yob.title: 6a2. Sibling 1 - Birth Year
sib1yob.description: (Date can be submitted as YYYY.((YYYY) 1875 to 2099, 9999 = Unknown)

sib1neu.title: 6a4. Sibling 1 - Primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition*
sib1neu.description: (*CODES for neurological problems and psychiatric conditions)
enum: 4 Other neurologic condition such as multiple sclerosis or stroke
5 Psychiatric condition such as schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, alcoholism, or depression
8 N/A, no neurological problem or psychiatric condition

sib1pdx.title: 6a5. Sibling 1 - Primary Dx**
enum: 040 Mild cognitive impairment (MCI), not otherwise specified
133 Primary progressive aphasia, not otherwise specified
999 Specific diagnosis unknown (acceptable if method of evaluation is not by autopsy, examination, or dementia evaluation)
431 FTLD with Tau pathology - Pick's disease
434 FTLD with Tau pathology - argyrophyllic grains
490 Other neuropathologic diagnosis not listed above

sib1moe.title: 6a6. Sibling 1 - Method of evaluation***
sib1moe.description: (***CODES for method of evaluation - See File Repository for APPENDIX 2: METHOD OF EVALUATION)
enum: 3 Medical record review from formal dementia evaluation
4 Review of general medical records AND co-participant and/or subject telephone interview
5 Review of general medical records only

kids.title: 7. How many biological children does the subject have?
kids.description:
If subject has no biological children,  END FORM HERE; otherwise provide information on all biological children below.For any biological child with a neurological or psychiatric condition, the entire row must be filled out. If the clinician cannot determine the primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition after reviewing all available evidence, enter 9=Unknown in the Primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition column, and then skip the subsequent questions in the row. For a biological child with no neurological or psychiatric problem, enter 8=N/A - no nuerological problem or psychiatric condition in the Primary neurological problem/psychiatric condition column, and then skip the subsequent questions in the row.
(99 = Unknown)

fadmut.title: 2a. In this family, is there evidence for an AD mutation? If Yes, select predominant mutation.

fftdmuso.title: 3b. Source of evidence for FTLD mutation (check one):

fftdmusx.title: 3b1.  Other (Specify the other source of evidence -FTLD mutation in this family)

fothmut.title: 4a. In this family, is there evidence for a mutation other than an AD or FTLD mutation?  (If No or Unknown, SKIP TO QUESTION 5a)

fothmutx.title: 4a1. Other (specify the other mutation in this family)

fothmuso.title: 4b. Source of evidence for other mutation (check one):
